abstract: Steve Richey, prosecutor for city of Columbia, Mo, reaches deal with University of Missouri assistant professor Melissa Click, giving her 20 hours of community service, instead of jail time or fines, for assaulting student journalist during November, 2015, campus protest.
lead_paragraph: Melissa Click, the suspended University of Missouri assistant professor who was charged with assault for a November run-in with two student journalists during campus protests, reached a deal with prosecutors.

headline.main: Missouri: Professor Held in Assault Gets Probation
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Professor Held in Assault Gets Probation

snippet: Melissa Click, the suspended University of Missouri assistant professor who was charged with assault for a November run-in with two student journalists during campus protests, reached a deal with prosecutors.
